intro: Kickxia scariosepala, commonly known as the scarlet globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bright red to orange-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a distinctive, waxy texture. Kickxia scariosepala thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping in arid regions.
